programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.sub-title: California v. Lyle and Erik Menendez
programme.desc: People couldn't imagine what made Erik and Lyle Menendez brutally murder their parents; the prosecution said it was greed and the defense said something much darker; a family secret that would shock and grip the nation.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Michael Jackson's personal doctor Conrad Murray took an oath to first do no harm, but that's exactly what prosecutors say Murray did when Jackson died from an overdose of a powerful anesthesia drug.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Rebecca Schaeffer was talented, pretty, and had her whole life ahead of her when she unknowingly opened the door of her Hollywood apartment to her killer Robert Bardo. Bardo's lawyers say his mental illness caused him to snap.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Dalia Dippolito reacquaints herself with her ex-boyfriend while she is married to Michael; the phone records between Dalia and Michael Stanley got steamy when Dalia was allegedly plotting ways to freeze her husband's bank account.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The jury listens to jailhouse phone calls between Dalia and Michael Dippolito; it shows an angry husband yelling at his wife, who was accused of plotting to have him murdered.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The Defense began questioning the lead investigator. Questions started with the credibility of the confidential informant. He was Dalia's friend, who got recorded evidence against her, in this alleged murder for hire plot to kill her husband Michael.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.sub-title: Stealing Money for the Murder Plot
programme.desc: The Defense has more detailed questions for the lead investigator on the case; during cross-examination, the Defense focuses on the recorded phone calls between Dalia and her former lover who said she originally asked him to kill her husband Michael.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The Defense zeroes in on the credibility of the police's confidential informant they used to get evidence against Dalia Dippolito.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The defense shifts jurors' attention to Michael Dippolito; Dalia's attorney says that his credibility was on the line since he was a known liar and fraudster.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Prosecutors say that the video and audio recordings show that Dalia Dippolito was certain she wanted Michael killed soon.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The State of Florida rests its case against Dalia Dippolito; this comes after the long testimony of the lead detective in the investigation who helped police foil an alleged plot to kill her husband, Michael.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The long cross-examination of the defendant is not over; Kit explains to the jury why there are delays in his military trial; the prosecution claims that Calvin Phillips was the defendant's main target.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: No eyewitnesses to the homicides, no DNA evidence linking Kit Martin to the victims, and, planted crime scene evidence; this is the defense's summary of the state's case against their client; Kit Martin's defense goes first in closing arguments.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: Blaming the ex-wife is a big part of the defense's closing argument; Lead attorney Tom Griffiths tells jurors he wishes that Joan Harmon had not pleaded the Fifth and testified.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: Kit Martin's defense team wraps up its closing argument in his triple murder trial, his lead attorney ridicules the state's case; it is now time for the state to deliver its closing argument.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The state says that Calvin, Pamela, and Edward are killed in a military-style execution; this is during closing arguments as prosecutors try to win a conviction against Kit; the lead prosecutor says that Joan is not the mastermind behind the crimes.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The lead prosecutor claims that Kit Martin is not as smart as he thinks he is; during closing arguments, Barbara Whaley argues that even though the defendant tried to cover up his crimes, he failed to clean up some incriminating evidence.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: It was a tragedy for the O'Keefe family when John died; that's what Caitlin Albert testifies to on the stand; jurors listen to several family members of the Albert family whose home was where O'Keefe was found unresponsive outside their property.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Last Person to Leave the Albert Home
programme.desc: The last person to leave the home where Boston police officer John O'Keefe is found dead after her testimony; Caitlin Albert was Brian Albert's daughter.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: It Was Just an Ordinary Day
programme.desc: The actions and connections of different members of the Albert family dominate testimony in this part of the trial; the Defense's attempt to shift jurors' attention away from evidence linking Karen Read to the death of her boyfriend, John O'Keefe.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The jury listens to more perspectives on the hours leading up to John O'Keefe's death.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Questioning one of the people who hung out with the Albert family, the defendant and her boyfriend, John O'Keefe; a friend of Brian Albert, Jr's is on the stand; establishing the events hours before the discovery of O'Keefe's body.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: A Black Object in the Snow
programme.desc: Julianna Nagel testifies that she noticed a black blob on the ground five or six feet long outside in the front yard of the Albert family home; she was a friend of Brian Albert, Jr's who spotted something out of the ordinary there.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Rabbi Fred Neulander was a pillar of his Cherry Hill, New Jersey community - the founder of a synagogue, a father and a husband. Little did anyone know, he was also an adulterer, one capable of hiring a hitman to murder his own wife.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Melanie McGuire made a living bringing life into the world as a fertility clinic nurse; the police accused her of shooting her husband, dismembering his body and disposing of it in suitcases dumped into the Chesapeake Bay.
